column1: Promethazine is a medicine used to treat nausea and vomiting.

Bladder and kidneys - Urinary hesitancy - Inability to urinate Heart and blood vessels - Rapid heartbeat - Weakness from low blood pressure Nervous system - Coma - Delirium - Depression - Disorientation - Drowsiness - Excitation - Fever - Hallucinations - Nervousness - Unsteadiness - Seizures - Tremor (unintentional trembling) Other - Flushed skin - Large (dilated) pupils with vision difficulty - Muscle stiffness in face or neck

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation),and ventilator (breathing machine) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through the vein (intravenous or IV) - Laxative - Medicines to treat symptoms
People who experience heart rhythm irregularities and seizures are at highest risk for a serious outcome.
